title: Configuration
description: A Configuration represents an autonomous network device, such as a router, host, switch, or firewall.

asPathAccessLists.description: Dictionary of all AS-path access-lists for this node.

communityLists.description: Dictionary of all community-lists for this node.

configurationFormat.description: Best guess at vendor configuration format. Used for setting default values, protocol costs, etc.

defaultCrossZoneAction.description: Default forwarding action to take for traffic that crosses firewall zones.

defaultInboundAction.description: Default forwarding action to take for traffic destined for this device.

deviceType.description: Best guess at type of this device.

ikeGateways.description: Dictionary of all IKE gateways for this node.

ikePolicies.description: Dictionary of all IKE policies for this node.

ikeProposals.description: Dictionary of all IKE proposals for this node.

interfaces.description: Dictionary of all interfaces across all VRFs for this node.

ip6AccessLists.description: Dictionary of all IPV6 access-lists for this node.

ipAccessLists.description: Dictionary of all IPV4 access-lists for this node.

ipsecPolicies.description: Dictionary of all IPSEC policies for this node.

ipsecProposals.description: Dictionary of all IPSEC proposals for this node.

ipsecVpns.description: Dictionary of all IPSEC VPNs for this node.

roles.description: Set of all roles in which this node serves.

route6FilterLists.description: Dictionary of all IPV6 route filter lists for this node.

routeFilterLists.description: Dictionary of all IPV4 route filter lists for this node.

routingPolicies.description: Dictionary of all routing policies for this node.

vendorFamily.description: Object containing vendor-specific information for this node.

vrfs.description: Dictionary of all VRFs for this node.

zones.description: Dictionary of all firewall zones for this node.

AsPathAccessList.description: An AsPathAccessList is used to filter e/iBGP routes according to their AS-path attribute.

lines.description: The list of lines against which a route's AS-path will be checked in order.

action.description: The action the underlying access-list will take when this line matches a route.

regex.description: The regex against which a route's AS-path will be compared

CommunityList.description: Represents a named access-list whose matching criteria is restricted to regexes on community attributes sent with a bgp advertisement

lines.description: The list of lines that are checked in order against the community attribute(s) of a bgp advertisement

invertMatch.description: Specifies whether or not lines should match the complement of their criteria (does not change whether a line permits or denies).

action.description: The action the underlying access-list will take when this line matches a route.

regex.description: The regex against which a route's communities will be compared

address.description: Remote IP address of IKE gateway

externalInterface.description: Logical (non-VPN) interface from which to connect to IKE gateway. This interface is used to determine source-address for the connection.

ikePolicy.description: IKE policy to be used with this IKE gateway.

localAddress.description: Local IP address from which to connect to IKE gateway. Used instead of external interface.

localId.description: Local IKE ID used in connection to IKE gateway.

remoteId.description: Remote IKE ID of IKE gateway.

accessVlan.description: Number of access VLAN when switchport mode is ACCESS

active.description: Whether this interface is administratively active (true) or disabled (false)

allPrefixes.description: All IPV4 address/network assignments on this interface

allowedVlans.description: Ranges of allowed VLANs when switchport mode is TRUNK

bandwidth.description: The nominal bandwidth of this interface in bits/sec for use in protocol cost calculations

inboundFilter.description: The IPV4 access-list used to filter traffic destined for this device on this interface.

incomingFilter.description: The IPV4 access-list used to filter traffic that arrives on this interface.

isisCost.description: The IS-IS cost of this interface

isisL1InterfaceMode.description: Specifies whether this interface is active, passive, or unconfigured with respect to IS-IS level 1

isisL2InterfaceMode.description: Specifies whether this interface is active, passive, or unconfigured with respect to IS-IS level 2

mtu.description: The maximum transmission unit (MTU) of this interface in bytes

nativeVlan.description: The native VLAN of this interface when switchport mode is TRUNK

ospfArea.description: The OSPF area to which this interface belongs.

ospfCost.description: The explicit OSPF cost of this interface. If unset, the cost is automatically calculated.

ospfDeadInterval.description: Dead-interval in seconds for OSPF updates

ospfEnabled.description: Whether or not OSPF is enabled at all on this interface (either actively or passively)

ospfHelloMultiplier.description: Number of OSPF packets to send out during dead-interval period for fast OSPF updates

ospfPassive.description: Whether or not OSPF is enabled passively on this interface. If passive, this interface is included in the OSPF RIB, but no OSPF packets are sent from it.

outgoingFilter.description: The IPV4 access-list used to filter traffic that is sent out this interface. Stored as @id

prefix.description: The primary IPV4 address/network of this interface

proxyArp.description: Whether or not proxy-ARP is enabled on this interface.

routingPolicy.description: The routing policy used on this interface for policy-routing (as opposed to destination-routing). Stored as @id

switchportMode.description: The switchport mode (if any) of this interface

switchportTrunkEncapsulation.description: The switchport trunk encapsulation type of this interface. Only relevant when switchport mode is TRUNK

vrf.description: The name of the VRF to which this interface belongs

zone.description: The firewall zone to which this interface belongs.

preSharedKeyHash.description: SHA-256 hash of salted version of pre-shared-key stored in original configuration

proposals.description: Dictionary of IKE proposals attached to this policy. Each stored as @id

authenticationAlgorithm.description: Authentication algorithm to use for connection to IKE gateway

authenticationMethod.description: Authentication method to use for connection to IKE gateway

diffieHellmanGroup.description: Diffie-Hellman group to use for key exchange

encryptionAlgorithm.description: Encryption algorithm to use for IKE traffic

lifetimeSeconds.description: Lifetime in seconds of connection to IKE gateway

Ip6AccessList.description: An access-list used to filter IPV6 packets

lines.description: The lines against which to check an IPV6 packet

action.description: The action the underlying access-list will take when this line matches an IPV6 packet.

name.description: The name of this line in the list

ack.description: Value for ACK bit if used (true->1/false->0)

cwr.description: Value for CWR bit if used (true->1/false->0)

ece.description: Value for ECE bit if used (true->1/false->0)

fin.description: Value for FIN bit if used (true->1/false->0)

psh.description: Value for PSH bit if used (true->1/false->0)

rst.description: Value for RST bit if used (true->1/false->0)

syn.description: Value for SYN bit if used (true->1/false->0)

urg.description: Value for URG bit if used (true->1/false->0)

useAck.description: Whether or not to match against the ACK bit

useCwr.description: Whether or not to match against the CWR bit

useEce.description: Whether or not to match against the ECE bit

useFin.description: Whether or not to match against the FIN bit

usePsh.description: Whether or not to match against the PSH bit

useRst.description: Whether or not to match against the RST bit

useSyn.description: Whether or not to match against the SYN bit

useUrg.description: Whether or not to match against the URG bit

IpAccessList.description: An access-list used to filter IPV4 packets

lines.description: The lines against which to check an IPV4 packet

action.description: The action the underlying access-list will take when this line matches an IPV4 packet.

dscps.description: A set of acceptable DSCP values for a packet

dstIps.description: A space of acceptable destination IP addresses for a packet

dstPorts.description: A set of acceptable destination port ranges for a TCP/UDP packet

ecns.description: A set of acceptable ECN values for a packet

fragmentOffsets.description: A set of acceptable fragment offsets for a UDP packet

icmpCodes.description: A set of acceptable ICMP code ranges for an ICMP packet

icmpTypes.description: A set of acceptable ICMP type ranges for an ICMP packet

ipProtocols.description: A set of acceptable IP protocols for a packet

name.description: The name of this line in the list

negate.description: Determines whether to match the complement of the stated criteria of this header space

notDscps.description: A set of unacceptable DSCP values for a packet

notDstIps.description: A space of unacceptable destination IP addresses for a packet

notDstPorts.description: A set of unacceptable destination port ranges for a TCP/UDP packet

notEcns.description: A set of unacceptable ECN values for a packet

notFragmentOffsets.description: A set of unacceptable fragment offsets for a UDP packet

notIcmpCodes.description: A set of unacceptable ICMP code ranges for an ICMP packet

notIcmpTypes.description: A set of unacceptable ICMP type ranges for an ICMP packet

notIpProtocols.description: A set of unacceptable IP protocols for a packet

notSrcIps.description: A space of unacceptable source IP addresses for a packet

notSrcPorts.description: A set of unacceptable source port ranges for a TCP/UDP packet

srcIps.description: A space of acceptable source IP addresses for a packet

srcOrDstIps.description: A space of IP addresses within which either the source or the destination IP of a packet must fall for acceptance

srcOrDstPorts.description: A set of ranges within which either the source or the destination port of a TCP/UDP packet must fall for acceptance

srcPorts.description: A set of acceptable source port ranges for a TCP/UDP packet

states.description: A set of acceptable abstract firewall states for a packet to match

tcpFlags.description: A set of acceptable TCP flag bitmasks for a TCP packet to match

proposals.description: IPSEC proposals to try with this policy

bindInterface.description: Tunnel interface on which the VPN will be bound

Route6FilterList.description: An access-list used to filter IPV6 routes

lines.description: The lines against which to check an IPV6 route

action.description: The action the underlying access-list will take when this line matches an IPV6 route.

lengthRange.description: The range of acceptable prefix-lengths for a route.

prefix.description: The bits against which to compare a route's prefix. The length of this prefix is used to determine how many leading bits must match.

RouteFilterList.description: An access-list used to filter IPV4 routes

lines.description: The lines against which to check an IPV4 route

action.description: The action the underlying access-list will take when this line matches an IPV4 route.

lengthRange.description: The range of acceptable prefix-lengths for a route.

prefix.description: The bits against which to compare a route's prefix. The length of this prefix is used to determine how many leading bits must match.

RoutingPolicy.description: A procedural routing policy used to transform and accept/reject IPV4/IPV6 routes

statements.description: The list of routing-policy statements to execute

Vrf.description: A virtual routing and forwarding (VRF) instance on a node.

aggregateRoutes.description: Generated IPV4 routes for this VRF

bgpProcess.description: BGP routing process for this VRF

generatedIpv6Routes.description: Generated IPV6 routes for this VRF

isisProcess.description: IS-IS routing process for this VRF

ospfProcess.description: OSPF routing process for this VRF

administrativeCost.description: Administrative cost for this route (usually based on protocol)

asPath.description: A BGP AS-path attribute to associate with this generated route

attributePolicy.description: The name of the policy that sets attributes of this route

discard.description: Whether this route is route is meant to discard all matching packets

generationPolicy.description: The name of the policy that will generate this route if another route matches it

nextHopInterface.description: The explicit next-hop interface for this route

generatedRoutes.description: IPV4 routes generated in the BGP RIB that are not imported into the main RIB for this VRF

neighbors.description: Neighbor relationships configured for this BGP process

routerId.description: The configured router ID for this BGP process. Note that it can be overridden for individual neighbors.

address.description: The IPV4 address of the remote peer if not dynamic (passive)

advertiseExternal.description: Whether to advertise the best eBGP route for each network independently of whether it is the best BGP route for that network

advertiseInactive.description: Whether to advertise the best BGP route for each network independently of whether it is the best overall route for that network

allowLocalAsIn.description: Whether to allow reception of advertisements containing the local AS number in the AS-path

allowRemoteAsOut.description: Whether to allow sending of advertisements containing the remote AS number in the AS-path

defaultMetric.description: Default MED for routes sent to this neighbor

dynamic.description: Whether this represents a connection to a specific peer (false) or a passive connection to a network of peers (true)

ebgpMultihop.description: Whether to allow establishment of a multihop eBGP connection with this peer

exportPolicy.description: The policy governing all advertisements sent to this peer

generatedRoutes.description: Generated routes specific to this peer not otherwise imported into any of this node's RIBs

group.description: Name of a group in the original vendor-specific configuration to which this peer is assigned

importPolicy.description: Routing policy governing all advertisements received from this peer

localAs.description: The local autonomous sysem of this peering

localIp.description: The local (source) IPV4 address of this peering

remoteAs.description: The remote autonomous sysem of this peering

remotePrefix.description: The remote (destination) IPV4 address of this peering (when prefix-length is 32), or the network of peers allowed to connect on this peering (otherwise)

routeReflectorClient.description: Whether or not this peer is a route-reflector client

sendCommunity.description: Whether or not to propagate the community attribute(s) of advertisements to this peer

vrf.description: The name of the VRF containing the BGP process containing this peering

generatedRoutes.description: Generated IPV4 routes for the purpose of export into IS-IS. These routes are not imported into the main RIB.

level.description: The IS-IS level(s) for this process

netAddress.description: The net address is an ISO address representing the IS-IS router ID.

areas.description: The OSPF areas contained in this process

exportPolicy.description: The routing policy applied to routes in the main RIB to determine which ones are to be exported into OSPF and how

generatedRoutes.description: Generated IPV4 routes for the purpose of export into OSPF. These routes are not imported into the main RIB.

referenceBandwidth.description: The reference bandwidth by which an interface's bandwidth is divided to determine its OSPF cost

routerId.description: The router-id of this OSPF process

interfaces.description: The interfaces assigned to this OSPF area

nextHopInterface.description: The explicit next-hop interface for this route

nextHopIp.description: The IPV4 address of the next-hop router for this route

tag.description: The non-transitive tag attribute of this route

administrativeCost.description: Administrative cost for this route (usually based on protocol)

fromHostFilter.description: Filter applied against packets originating from an interface in this zone on this node

inboundFilter.description: Filter applied against packets whose final destination is an interface in this zone that does not have its own inbound filter

inboundInterfaceFilters.description: Mapping of interfaces in this zone to their corresponding inbound filters: the filter applied against packets whose final destination is the interface whose name is the key in this mapping

toHostFilter.description: Filter applied against packets whose final destination is an interface in this zone. If this filter exists, it is applied IN ADDITION to the interface-specific or default inbound filter.

toZonePolicies.description: Maps names of destination zones to the corresponding filter applied against packets which are received on this zone and routed to the named zone
